5967.Definicao: AIDS is a clinical disease resulting from immunodeficiency caused by HIV (HIV-1 and HIV-2, the latter with no epidemiological relevance in Brazil). It is characterized by profound suppression of immunity mediated mainly by T cells, resulting in opportunistic infections, secondary neoplasias and neurological diseases. HIV (AIDS virus) is transmitted through: sexual contact, transmission of the virus from infected mothers to fetuses or newborns and through blood (such as transfusions of blood and blood products or shared use of injectable drugs).

With the decrease in circulation, damage to the affected organs occurs, causing pain, destruction of blood cells, jaundice (yellow eyes) and anemia.

6045.Definicao: The most common esophageal cancer is squamous cell carcinoma, which accounts for 96% of cases. Adenocarcinoma has been increasing significantly, especially in cases of BAPRET esophagus, when there is abnormal growth of gastric-type cells into the esophagus. It is more common after the age of 40 and is associated with high consumption of alcoholic beverages and tobacco products (smoking).

6046.Definicao: Stomach cancer (also called gastric cancer) is a disease in which malignant cells are found in the tissues of the stomach. Stomach cancer tumors predominantly present in the form of three histological types: adenocarcinoma, responsible for 95% of gastric tumors, lymphoma, diagnosed in approximately 3% of cases, and leiomyosarcoma.

6047.Definicao: Malignant neoplasm responsible for 1/5 of female cancer deaths. In the USA, the overall risk is around 10% (5 times more than in Japan or China) and the risk of dying from it is 3.6%. It is rare before the age of 25, but in the most exposed age group (65-85 years), the risk does not exceed 5.5%. The cause is unknown and, in the last 30 or 40 years, there has been no significant change in the global situation (around 90 thousand cases and 376 thousand deaths per year). Factors that increase the risk are geographic, genetic, age, duration of the reproductive period, nulliparity, age at first birth, obesity and, perhaps, a diet with high lipid and alcohol content.

6048.Definicao: Malignant neoplasms of the exocrine portion of the gland, almost always derived from the ductal epithelium – adenocarcinomas –, which produce insidious and highly fatal tumors, with a three-fold increase in countries like the USA in recent decades, if not the cause attributed to smoking, to diet and chemical carcinogens.

6049.Definicao: As the skin is a heterogeneous organ, this type of cancer can present neoplasms of different lineages. The most frequent are: basal cell carcinoma, responsible for 70% of skin cancer diagnoses, squamous cell carcinoma with 25% of cases and melanoma, detected in 4% of patients. Fortunately, basalcular carcinoma, the most common, is also the least aggressive. This type and squamous cell carcinoma are also called non-melanoma skin cancer, while melanoma and other types originating in melanocytes are called melanoma skin cancer.

6050.Definicao: Rare before the age of 50, its frequency increases rapidly afterwards. It usually begins in the peripheral, posterior area of ​​the gland, which makes it accessible to rectal examination. It grows as an invasive compact mass (towards the seminal vesicles and base of the bladder) and metastasizes, both via the blood and lymphatic route. Hematogenous dissemination occurs mainly to the bones, the proximal part of the femur, pelvis, thoracic spine and ribs, in descending order of sequences, and metastasis may be osteolytic or osteoblastic. Symptoms, which appear late, include dysuria, hematuria or pain; sometimes back pain caused by metastases.

6051.Definicao: Cervical neoplasia, more common in women aged between 40 and 45 years, generally associated with the presence of Papillomavirus type 16 or 18 (rarely others). The infection is sexually transmitted and determines cellular changes detectable by the Pap smear method.

6053.Definicao: Specialized sector of medicine that deals with the study and treatment of tumors.

6054.Definicao: Primary lesion caused by Treponema pallidum, which is the bacteria that causes syphilis. It normally does not cause pain and appears on the glans or the inner layer of the foreskin. It has a rounded or oval shape, with slightly raised edges. Hard chancre is the first sign of syphilis.

6055.Definicao: It is a sexually transmitted disease – STD that is characterized by the appearance, on the genitals, of vesicles that fill with pus and turn into wounds that begin to purge profusely, unlike what happens with hard chancre, the ulcerations caused by chancroid is usually painful and appears in multiple lesions. This STD is caused by a bacteria called Haemophilus ducreyi.

6056.Definicao: Traditionally called moniliasis or “thrush”, it is an infection of the vagina or vulva, caused by the Candida Albicans fungus. It is characterized by whitish vaginal discharge, itching and inflammation of the mucous membranes, which become red and covered with plaques. Although sexual transmission is not the only form of transmission, candidiasis is considered a sexually transmitted disease. In cases of immunodeficiency, it can also appear on the penis, in the esophagus, and even become a disseminated infection throughout the body (in cases of advanced immunodeficiency).

6057.Definicao: Nationally based computerized system that enables the linking of procedures carried out by the Unified Health System (SUS) to the user, the professional who performed it and also to the health unit.

6058.Definicao: These are places that welcome women victims of domestic and sexual violence, with their minor sons and daughters. The place is confidential and they can stay for a specified period, receiving medical, psychological assistance and professional training.

6059.Definicao: It is a receptor present mainly on T-helper lymphocytes (therefore called CD4+ T-Lymphocytes) where HIV binds to initiate infection of these cells. Other molecules present in the membrane of T-lymphocytes play an auxiliary, but relevant, role in this HIV/T-lymphocyte binding process, and are called co-receptors.

6060.Definicao: Helper lymphocyte, also called T-helper cell. It is where the CD4 particle is located, through which HIV binds to the cell, weakening the immune system.

6061.Definicao: Type of lymphocyte also called T-suppressor, which has cytotoxicity and immune response control functions.

6062.Definicao: The centers, structured at state, regional and/or municipal levels, organize the relationship between the various services, qualifying the flow of patients in the system and generate a communication gateway open to the general public, through which requests for help can be made. are received, evaluated and prioritized.

6064.Definicao: It articulates the work of the State Centers and provides the means for the transfer of organs between states with a view to addressing urgent situations and avoiding the waste of organs without conditions for using their origin.

6065.Definicao: Care service for patients with mental disorders, alternative to conventional hospitalization, providing care for 8 or 12 hours, or even 24 hours. Therapeutic and STD/HIV/AIDS prevention workshops are part of the routine of this service, including counseling and offering anti-HIV testing, in addition to helping to monitor adherence to antiretrovirals for those users with HIV/AIDS.

6069.Definicao: Responsible for defining standards, technical procedures and operational guidelines for the National Epidemiological Surveillance System. It must promote technical cooperation and advise the State and Municipal Health Departments. It works to promote and disseminate the use of epidemiological methodology at all levels of the SUS.

6070.Definicao: It aims to organize the interstate referral flow of patients requiring highly complex elective hospital care, and to guarantee financing for this care.

6071.Definicao: Health establishment installed in population groups exceeding 30,000 inhabitants that carries out activities in medical areas defined through the epidemiological profile and resources existing in each region. For minor surgery and rest beds.

When the infection occurs in the mother's womb, the consequences can be serious, causing the baby to experience mental retardation, blindness, deafness and/or cerebral palsy. In immunocompromised individuals, it can cause serious illness, which, in turn, can lead to blindness and even death. In patients with AIDS, involvement of the retina, digestive tract and central nervous system is more common.

6761.Definicao: Relating to the colon or rectum.

6764.Definicao: A system that incorporates processes to minimise all risks in an organisation.

6766.Definicao: Similar to corticosteroid hormones that are produced by the adrenal glands, which are small glands at the top of the kidney. Often known as steroids, they are prescribed for a variety of conditions, via tablets, injection, inhalers, creams and so on.

6773.Definicao: Doppler effect (or the Doppler shift) is the change in frequency or wavelength of a wave.

6774.Definicao: A period of time (often 6-12 weeks) spent away from a medical degree on a placement, often overseas. A wide range of other health-related degree courses can also include an elective, such as dentistry, nursing, physiotherapy and pharmacy. When you have a test or operation planned for the future, the doctors may call it an ‘elective’ test or operation. This just means that it’s not an emergency and that it is planned to happen at some point in the future.

6779.Definicao: A medical procedure in which a tube is placed into the windpipe (trachea) through the mouth or nose.

6780.Definicao: Using wires, catheters, balloons, stents and devices to treat arterial disease in a minimally invasive way.

6781.Definicao: This is the injection of local anaesthetic or other pain-relieving medicines into a space that surrounds your spinal cord. It temporarily numbs your nerves. A procedure were a form of pain relief is injected into the space around the spinal cord to stop pain without sending the patient to sleep.

6785.Definicao: Part of a doctor’s training and takes place after the completion of a medical degree at university. It comprises a series of rotations in different specialties within hospitals or in the community. The first year of training is known as FY1 and the second FY2. Foundation training precedes specialist training in medicine or surgery.

6786.Definicao: Results for GCSE subjects in England are graded U to 9, with grades 4-9 being equivalent to GCSE grades C and above.

6789.Definicao: Results for GCSE subjects in England are graded U to 9, with grades 4-9 being equivalent to GCSE grades C and above.

6793.Definicao: Abnormal sounds caused by turbulent blood flow within the heart.

6796.Definicao: A project to gain a better understanding of how certain traits and characteristics are passed on from parents to children.

6801.Definicao: A small T-shaped device made from plastic and copper that is fitted in the uterus to prevent pregnancy. Also called a coil.

6808.Definicao: The processes, both physical and chemical, by which the living body is built up and maintained, and by which molecules are broken down to make energy available to the organism.

6811.Definicao: Valve with two tapered cusps, located between the left atrium and the left ventricle of the heart. Also called the bicuspid valve.

6818.Definicao: The period of time following a baby’s birth, up to four weeks after birth.

The examination takes place via a series of stations usually lasting 5-10 minutes, and the student progresses from station to station with a different examiner each time. Actors may be used in place of real patients.

6824.Definicao: Where a member of staff is available to be called for work, usually outside normal working hours. This can involve answering enquiries over the phone, or physically attending the workplace. It can also sometimes involve sleeping at the workplace to be available to deal with emergencies.

6829.Definicao: The goal of perioperative care is to provide better conditions for patients before, during and after the operation. The time before and after an operation.

6830.Definicao: An action plan based on self awareness, values, reflection, goal-setting and planning for career development. Abbreviated to PDP.

6832.Definicao: A small needle is inserted into the space between the lungs and the chest wall to remove fluid that has accumulated around the lung.

6833.Definicao: Regional anesthesia techniques that are sometimes employed as an alternative to general anesthesia for surgery of the shoulder, arm, forearm, wrist and hand.

6834.Definicao: The administration of different drugs taken together, which increases the likelihood of side effects from drug interactions.

6837.Definicao: A blood clot in the pulmonary artery or in the lung.

6839.Definicao: A way of preventing mistakes or defects in products and avoiding problems in customer service.

6840.Definicao: Treatment of cancer patients with x-rays or other radiation. Using radioactive materials to treat diseases.

6842.Definicao: Symptoms that indicate a potentially serious disease and warrant prompt investigation and treatment.

6843.Definicao: Related to the respiratory (breathing) system, which includes the nose, throat (pharynx), larynx, windpipe (trachea), lungs and diaphragm.

6844.Definicao: Some medical trainee pathway posts are such that, once the trainee starts a pathway, provided they meet the Annual Review of Competence Programme (ARCP), they will continue on that pathway until they reach the end of their training.

6845.Definicao: A serious inherited blood disorder where the red blood cells develop abnormally.

6847.Definicao: NHS Scientist Training Programme. A graduate entry route to become a clinical scientist.

6852.Definicao: Professionally applied topical fluorides include higher-strength rinses, gels, and foams and fluoride varnishes;.

6853.Definicao: Plural of topology, an area of mathematics concerned with the properties of space.

6855.Definicao: Also known as a “mini-stroke”, this occurs when there is a brief interruption of the blood supply to the brain, causing symptoms similar to those of a stroke. The symptoms typically last less than one hour and are completely resolved within 24 hours.

6862.Definicao: A scraping or rubbing away of the skin or other surface.

6863.Definicao: A tooth or implant to which a fixed prosthesis is anchored.

6875.Definicao: A shoulder joint that connects the clavicle to the scapula.

6881.Definicao: The ability of an organism to change genetically in a way that allows it to deal better with its environmental conditions.

6882.Definicao: The ability of the body to learn to fight specific infections after being exposed to the germs that cause them.

6883.Definicao: Loss of control over indulging in a substance or performing an action or behavior, and continued craving for it despite negative consequences.

6892.Definicao: Centers providing daytime services to adults who need supervision, social support, or assistance with daily activities.

6893.Definicao: An ingredient in a medicinal product (herb, supplement, or prescription drug), which dilutes the purity of the product and does not contribute to its therapeutic effects.

6905.Definicao: A loss of brain function that occurs rapidly in some AIDS patients; marked by forgetfulness, difficulty thinking, and trouble focusing.

6906.Definicao: Continuing consumption of alcohol despite alcohol-related social or interpersonal problems.

6911.Definicao: Having a sensitivity to one or more normally harmless substances.

6913.Definicao: Hair loss that involves the entire body.

Also used to treat some prostate gland problems. Alpha blockers are also known as alpha-adrenergic antagonists, alpha-adrenergic blocking agents, and alpha-adrenergic blockers.

6916.Definicao: Fruit-derived acids used in creams and lotions to act as exfoliants.

6917.Definicao: A type of brain wave generated when a person is relaxed, awake, and receiving no visual input (eyes closed or in the dark).

6918.Definicao: Abnormal deep sleep; also called non-restorative sleep.

6919.Definicao: A drug used to treat Type 2 diabetes.

6920.Definicao: The part of the jawbone that supports the teeth.

6922.Definicao: A progressive brain disease that causes memory loss, impaired thinking, and personality changes.

6925.Definicao: Part of the brain involved in memory and emotion.

6926.Definicao: A protein that collects in tissues when certain diseases, including Alzheimer’s disease, are present.

6929.Definicao: The active growth phase of the hair-growth cycle.

6930.Definicao: The last inch of the large intestine, leading to the anal opening.

6932.Definicao: Differences in how a test is done, for example how a sample is prepared, which can affect test outcomes.

6933.Definicao: A severe allergic reaction, causing symptoms spanning from itching and swelling to trouble breathing, convulsions, shock, and coma.

6937.Definicao: A birth defect in which an infant is born without most of the brain or without the skull bones covering the brain.

6941.Definicao: An enzyme that converts the inactive form of the protein angiotensin (angiotensin I) to its active form—angiotensin II. Usually abbreviated as ACE.

Traducoes.pt: inibidor da enzima conversora de angiotensina

6944.Definicao: Means crooked or bent; refers to stiffening of a joint.

6946.Definicao: Term used to describe ring or circle shaped objects or body parts.

6947.Definicao: The tough outer covering of the discs in the spine.

6949.Definicao: A heart attack affecting the front of the heart.

6950.Definicao: A substance that kills or slows the growth of bacteria.

6957.Definicao: Medications used to lower and control high blood pressure.

6958.Definicao: A type of asthma medication that reduces swelling in airways and prevents muscles near the airways from tightening.

6959.Definicao: A general term for antibiotics and other drugs that fight microscopic organisms in the body, such as bacteria, viruses, fungi, and parasites.

6963.Definicao: Drug that relieves cramps and muscle spasms.

6964.Definicao: Drugs used to treat an overactive thyroid.

6970.Definicao: A virus transmitted by mosquitoes or other member of the arthropod phylum.

6971.Definicao: The state of being awake or reactive to stimuli through one or more of the five senses.

6972.Definicao: The small muscle associated with an individual hair follicle that enables hair to stand on end.

6975.Definicao: Abnormal connections between veins and arteries, usually caused by a birth defect.

6977.Definicao: Joining together two bones to reduce pain and provide stability to a damaged, arthritic, or painful joint.

6978.Definicao: Smooth white tissue that covers the ends of bones where they come together to form joints.

6980.Definicao: A drug that relieves pain, fever, and swelling, and inhibits the formation of blood clots.

6982.Definicao: The part of the cerebral cortex involved in processing information, rather than movement or sensory experiences.

6983.Definicao: A disease that inflames and narrows airways, causing wheezing, shortness of breath, coughing, and tightness in the chest.

6984.Definicao: A substance that contracts skin tissues and shrinks pores.

6985.Definicao: The absence of electrical activity in the heart.

6986.Definicao: Being unable to control movement; symptoms include shaking and an unsteady walk.

6987.Definicao: A mixture of fats, cholesterol, and other tissue that builds up on artery walls.

6990.Definicao: Another name for the topmost vertebra of the neck, which lies just beneath the skull. Also called C-1.

6991.Definicao: Having an inherited predisposition to allergies.

6992.Definicao: A long-term skin condition, most common in babies and children, in which areas of the skin are dry, itchy, red, and may crack. Also known as eczema.

6993.Definicao: A seasonal or year-round allergy marked by sneezing, runny nose, and congestion.

6994.Definicao: Abbreviation for adenosine triphosphate, an energy-storing molecule that is found in all human cells.

6995.Definicao: The upper chambers of the heart. There are two of these—the right atrium and the left atrium.

6996.Definicao: A disorder in which the two upper chambers of the heart beat fast and erratically. Because blood isn’t pumped out of these chambers fully, it may pool and form clots that could lead to a stroke.

6997.Definicao: Also known as the AV node. A major part of the electrical system in the heart that acts as a gateway between the atria and the ventricles. An electrical signal generated by the sinoatrial node (the heart's natural pacemaker) moves through the heart until it reaches the atrioventricular node, a cluster of cells at the bottom of the right atrium. The AV node delays the signal before it is passed to the ventricles. This lets the atria fully contract before the ventricles contract.

6998.Definicao: One of the two upper chambers of the heart. One of the heart's two upper chambers (the plural form is atria). The right atrium receives deoxygenated blood from the body; the left atrium receives oxygenated blood from the lungs.

6999.Definicao: Wasting away of an organ or tissue due to undernourishment, disease, or aging.

7001.Definicao: A chart that shows a person’s ability to hear at different pitches or frequencies.

7002.Definicao: A health professional who assesses hearing and fits hearing aids.

7003.Definicao: A nerve in the inner ear that transmits information about sound to the brain.

7004.Definicao: Sensations such as chills, flashes of light, or a blind spot that come just before the occurrence of medical problems such as migraines or seizures.

7005.Definicao: Proteins created by the immune system that mistakenly target healthy cells, tissues, or organs.

7010.Definicao: Damage to the nerves that control involuntary body functions, such as digestion, heart rate, and bladder and bowel function.

7011.Definicao: Surgically opening and examining a body after death to see if any diseases are present and to determine the cause of death.

7012.Definicao: Abbreviation for atrioventricular node, a major part of the electrical system in the heart that acts as a gateway between the atria and the ventricles. An electrical signal generated by the sinoatrial node (the heart's natural pacemaker) moves through the heart until it reaches the atrioventricular node, a cluster of cells at the bottom of the right atrium. The AV node delays the signal before it is passed to the ventricles. This lets the atria fully contract before the ventricles contract.

7033.Definicao: The period of grief and mourning after a death.

7037.Definicao: Cells that make and secrete insulin; located in the islets of Langerhans of the pancreas.

7046.Definicao: How quickly and completely the body can absorb and use a nutrient.

BMI = weight (in kilograms) divided by height (in meters) squared. 7063.Definicao: A measure of body fat estimated from a person’s height and weight. A healthy BMI is defined as 18.5 to 24.9. BMI = weight (in kilograms) divided by height (in meters) squared. Using English units, multiply weight in pounds by 703, then divide the result by height in inches, and divide that result by height in inches.

7152.Definicao: A nerve cell that produces acetylcholine.

7153.Definicao: A disorder of ongoing, severe tiredness that interferes with a person’s ability to function well, isn’t improved with rest, and isn’t caused by another illness.

7988.Definicao: A fasting blood sugar level above a healthy level, but still below the level used to diagnose diabetes. An individual with prediabetes is at increased risk for developing diabetes.

7989.Definicao: Blood pressure that is above normal but not high enough to qualify as hypertension. An individual with prehypertension is at increased risk for developing hypertension.

7990.Definicao: A method of reducing cardiac workload by decreasing the pressure of blood entering the heart.

7991.Definicao: An early beat in an atria that feels like the heart skipped a beat.

7992.Definicao: Ejaculation that occurs before or immediately after penetration; this can interfere with a couple having a mutually satisfying sexual experience.

7993.Definicao: An early beat in a ventricle that feels like the heart skipped a beat.

7994.Definicao: Age-related difficulty focusing the eyes at close range, as the flexible lens of the eye becomes less elastic.

7995.Definicao: A commonly used skin test to confirm hypersensitivity to a broad range of allergens.

7996.Definicao: Use of angioplasty as the first treatment to open a blocked artery that is causing a heart attack, rather than using clot-busting (thrombolytic) drugs.

7997.Definicao: High blood pressure with no known cause. Also known as essential hypertension.

7998.Definicao: Bone loss that results from a normal physiological process, such as menopause or aging.

7999.Definicao: A public, legal process supervised by the courts after a person dies that helps ensure debts are paid and assets are properly owned and correctly distributed.

8000.Definicao: Live microorganisms used to benefit health, such as the L. acidophilus bacteria found in yogurt.

8001.Definicao: The long-term memory of skills and procedures, or how-to knowledge. Also called implicit memory.

8002.Definicao: Bony projections that extend in several directions from each vertebra bone in the spine.

8003.Definicao: A synthetic compound that produces effects similar to those of the hormone progesterone.

8004.Definicao: Any hormone having the same effect as progesterone in the body; refers to both natural progesterone and synthetic progestin.

8005.Definicao: A mind/body technique for inducing the relaxation response that involves isolating, tensing, and relaxing specific sets of muscles in sequence.

8006.Definicao: When part of a spinal disk bulges out of a tear or weak spot in the disk’s tough outer shell. Also known as herniated disk.

8007.Definicao: An advanced stage of diabetic eye disease characterized by the development of new blood vessels that grow into the vitreous cavity; they are fragile and may bleed and cause loss of vision.

8008.Definicao: The ability to sense the position of one’s body in space, in relation to other objects.

8009.Definicao: Forward bulging or displacement of an organ, especially of an eye. See exophthalmos.

8010.Definicao: A type of research method that collects data on a group of people at the start of the study and then follows them into the future, gathering data over time.

8011.Definicao: A group of chemicals that have hormone-like actions; prostaglandins help regulate blood pressure and contraction of smooth-muscle cells (for example, those in the lining of the blood vessels).

8013.Definicao: A walnut-shaped gland at the base of the male bladder. It produces a fluid that forms part of semen.

8014.Definicao: A protein produced by the prostate. Elevated levels may indicate the presence of cancer, benign prostatic hyperplasia, or prostatitis. Often referred to as PSA.

8016.Definicao: A small, springlike cylinder, designed to relieve pressure from an enlarged prostate and improve urine flow by widening a narrowed urethra.

8017.Definicao: A blockage at the base of the bladder that reduces or prevents the flow of urine into the urethra, the tube that carries urine out of the body (also known as bladder outlet obstruction). Typical symptoms include feeling the need to urinate right away yet having to strain to do so, having a weak urinary stream, dribbling after urinating, feeling as though the bladder has not been emptied completely, needing to urinate frequently, or experiencing urinary incontinence.

8018.Definicao: An artificial device such as a hearing aid, artificial joint, or dentures that substitutes for a missing body part.

8019.Definicao: A plan that lays out the procedures that will be followed in conducting a physical examination, a research study, or the treatment of a disease.

8021.Definicao: The rate at which a man’s PSA level increases over time.

8022.Definicao: A decongestant drug that may also relieve mild incontinence.

8023.Definicao: Arthritis caused by crystals of calcium pyrophosphate dihydrate in the joints. Also known as calcium pyrophosphate dihydrate disease.

8024.Definicao: A common skin disease characterized by thickened patches of inflamed red skin; sometimes accompanied by painful joint swelling and stiffness.

8025.Definicao: A form of therapy that focuses on how life events, desires, and close relationships lead to conflict, symptoms such as anxiety or depression, and difficulty in managing life’s tasks.

8026.Definicao: Symptoms and illnesses that have a psychological cause, rather than a physical one.

8027.Definicao: Difficulty in getting or maintaining erections because of a psychological cause, such as stress or depression.

8028.Definicao: Abbreviation for percutaneous transluminal coronary angioplasty, a procedure used to open blocked coronary arteries.

8029.Definicao: Abbreviation for post-traumatic stress disorder, a prolonged reaction to a traumatic event. PTSD can cause crippling anxiety and leading to other problems, such as sleep disturbances, depression, and substance abuse.

8030.Definicao: A pelvic floor muscle that forms a sling around the rectum and helps maintain fecal continence.

8031.Definicao: Arteries supplying blood to the genital area.

8033.Definicao: A condition caused by excess fluid accumulating in the lungs, making breathing difficult.

8034.Definicao: Blockage of one or more arteries in the lungs by a blood clot that formed elsewhere, often in the legs. Typically accompanied by sudden shortness of breath, chest pain, and cough.

8035.Definicao: The veins that carry blood from the lungs to the left atrium.

8036.Definicao: Tissue containing nerves and blood vessels that fills the chamber at the center of the tooth.

8037.Definicao: The difference between systolic blood pressure and diastolic blood pressure (systolic pressure minus diastolic pressure = pulse pressure). Pulse pressure may help predict heart disease risk.

8038.Definicao: When the heart muscle becomes so weak that it can no longer pump enough blood to the rest of the body.

8041.Definicao: Paralysis of all limbs, often caused by a severe neck injury.

8042.Definicao: A modification of computed tomography that provides measurements of bone mass as well as an image.

8043.Definicao: Medications that quickly open the bronchial tubes by relaxing the muscles surrounding these airways.

8044.Definicao: Any sleep other than REM sleep, in which thinking and most physiological activities slow, but movement still occurs. Also called non-REM sleep.

8045.Definicao: A condition in which the radial nerve is compressed at the elbow, causing pain, numbness, tingling, and muscle weakness in the hand and arm.

8046.Definicao: Treatment with high-energy rays (from x-rays or other sources) designed to control disease and destroy cancer cells.

8047.Definicao: Surgery to remove the entire prostate.

8048.Definicao: A radioactive form of iodine that can be used as a tracer during a radioactive iodine uptake test or a radioactive thyroid scan. Much larger amounts are used in the treatment of hyperthyroidism.

8049.Definicao: A blood test used for identifying allergens.

8050.Definicao: A non-surgical technique using an electromagnetic current to penetrate deep into the body’s tissues, which can be used to treat pain, cancer, and heart rhythm disorders, among other conditions.

8052.Definicao: Another name for nuclear teststests that use tiny amounts of short-lived radioactive substances that can target particular organs or cell receptors to diagnose disease.

8053.Definicao: Short-lived radioactive chemicals that are used in nuclear imaging tests.

8054.Definicao: Abnormal lung sounds that might be a sign of fluid buildup congestion in the lungs.

8055.Definicao: A feature of many clinical trials in which participants are randomly assigned to either a group to be tested or a control group.

8056.Definicao: A study in which researchers choose a study population at random; one group receives the intervention (such as a nutritional supplement) and another group receives a placebo. Often referred to as an RCT.

8057.Definicao: The extent of movement—and thus flexibility—in a joint, measured in the degrees of a circle.

8058.Definicao: A period of intense brain activity during sleep, often associated with dreams; named for the rapid eye movements that occur during this time. Also called dreaming sleep.

8059.Definicao: Abbreviation for radioallergosorbent test, a blood test used for identifying allergens.

8060.Definicao: A condition in which the blood vessels in the fingers and other extremities narrow in response to cold or stress, causing them to turn white or blue.

8061.Definicao: Abbreviation for randomized controlled trial, a study in which researchers choose a study population at random; one group receives the intervention (such as a nutritional supplement) and another group receives a placebo.

8062.Definicao: Abbreviation for recommended dietary allowance, the average daily amount of a nutrient that will meet the nutritional needs of almost all (97%–98%) healthy people at specific stages of their lives.

8063.Definicao: Joint problems triggered by bacterial or viral infection elsewhere in the body.

8064.Definicao: Insomnia caused by withdrawal from sleep medication; usually it is at least as serious as before the medication was used.

8065.Definicao: Structures on the outside of a cell membrane that permit attachment of specific chemicals.

8066.Definicao: A thrombolytic (clot-dissolving) drug made using recombinant DNA technology; used to dissolve blood clots causing an ischemic stroke, pulmonary embolism, or myocardial infarction.

8067.Definicao: The average daily amount of a nutrient that will meet the nutritional needs of almost all (97%–98%) healthy people at specific stages of their lives.

8068.Definicao: A process of overcoming addiction to alcohol, other psychoactive substance, or addictive behavior. Often this involves a commitment to abstinence, but sometimes it involves reduced use rather than complete abstinence.

8069.Definicao: A weakening of the vaginal wall that allows the rectum to bulge into the vagina.

8070.Definicao: The deflection of light as it passes through one medium to another of different density; also refers an eye test to evaluate the eye’s ability to focus.

8071.Definicao: A professional trained to evaluate driving skills and, when appropriate, suggest equipment and adaptations to make driving safer for people with certain physical or mental limitations.

8072.Definicao: The return of symptoms and disease after a person seems to have recovered.

8073.Definicao: The physical effects of meditation and certain other techniques that are opposite to those of the stress response. Effects include marked drops in oxygen consumption, carbon dioxide expiration, heartbeat, and respiration, as well as stabilization or lowering of blood pressure.

8074.Definicao: Abbreviation for rapid eye movement, which occurs during a period of sleep characterized by intense brain activity, often associated with dreams.

8075.Definicao: A sleep disorder marked by movement during REM sleep, when muscles are normally paralyzed.

8076.Definicao: An increase in REM sleep, often with nightmares, that occurs after deprivation of REM sleep or the withdrawal of REM-suppressing medications.

8077.Definicao: A lessening in the severity of a disease and its symptoms. In cancer, a reduction in the size of a tumor and its symptoms.

8078.Definicao: Altering a body part. Bone is constantly being remodeled in response to exercise or inactivity. Heart tissue is remodeled in response to a heart attack or high blood pressure.

8080.Definicao: Narrowing of an artery that supplies blood to the kidney.

8081.Definicao: Re-establishing blood flow, such as when a blockage in a coronary artery that is causing a heart attack is cleared.

8082.Definicao: Techniques used to restart circulation to part of the heart or brain that has been cut off from blood flow during a heart attack or stroke. Reperfusion may entail clot-dissolving drugs, balloon angioplasty, or surgery.

8083.Definicao: Number of times an exercise calls for a muscle to be worked and released (usually eight to 12). Often referred to as reps.

8084.Definicao: An instrument that permits a surgeon to view the inside of a body cavity in order to remove a part of an organ or structure.

8085.Definicao: The habitat in which an infectious agent normally lives, grows, and multiplies. Reservoirs include human, animal, and environmental reservoirs.

8086.Definicao: The ability to adapt to change and recover quickly from setbacks such as illness, injury, or misfortune.

8087.Definicao: The ability of a pathogen to withstand drugs previously effective against them. Usually the result of genetic mutation.

8088.Definicao: High blood pressure that does not respond to drug therapy and lifestyle changes.

8089.Definicao: The removal of bone tissue, both mineral and protein, by osteoclasts.

8090.Definicao: The process by which gases enter the body, including external respiration (breathing), and internal respiration, in which oxygen taken in by the lungs is carried by the blood to tissues and carbon dioxide is removed.

8091.Definicao: Renarrowing of a blood vessel that has been widened with angioplasty.

8092.Definicao: The rate at which the body burns calories while at rest. Resting energy expenditure accounts for 60%–75% of the daily calories burned.

8093.Definicao: Achy or unpleasant feelings in the legs associated with a need to move. Most prominent at night, making it hard to fall asleep or stay asleep.

8094.Definicao: The innermost layer of the eye, which converts light energy to electrical energy and sends visual images to the brain via the optic nerve.

8095.Definicao: A condition in which the retina separates from the choroid (the back of the eye) and leads to a loss of vision.

8096.Definicao: The act of recalling previously learned information, involving the reactivation of particular nerve-cell pathways in the brain related to that piece of information.

8097.Definicao: An adverse effect of both prostate surgery and some medications that causes semen to flow back into the bladder rather than out through the penis.

8098.Definicao: A research method that looks for possible causes for a current disease by examining a study population's past habits.

8099.Definicao: The theory that some people turn to addiction to compensate for an inability to sufficiently experience pleasure.

Traducoes.es: teoría de la insuficiencia de recompensa

8100.Definicao: An interrelated set of brain regions that are all involved in recognizing, experiencing, and remembering pleasurable or rewarding events.

8101.Definicao: Any one of over 100 disorders that cause inflammation in connective tissues.

8102.Definicao: Pain and stiffness of soft tissues in and around joints.

8103.Definicao: An antibody found in about 85% of people with rheumatoid arthritis; also appears in other diseases and sometimes in healthy people.

8104.Definicao: A surgical procedure that involves removing excess skin and tightening the underlying muscle to correct sagging around the jaws, jowls, and neck. Does not include work on the eyes or forehead. Commonly known as a face lift.

8105.Definicao: An itchy condition of the scalp caused by a fungal infection. Also known as tinea capitis.

8106.Definicao: A simple hearing test that uses a tuning fork to determine what type of hearing loss a person has.

8107.Definicao: Drinking that increases the chances of adverse consequences; drinking more than guidelines on moderate drinking suggest.

8108.Definicao: Abbreviation for restless legs syndrome, an achy or unpleasant feelings in the legs associated with a need to move. Most prominent at night, making it hard to fall asleep or stay asleep.

8109.Definicao: Light-sensitive cells in the retina that respond best in darkness and dim light.

8110.Definicao: The portion of the tooth below the gum line.

8111.Definicao: A channel in the root of the tooth that contains the pulp.

8112.Definicao: A procedure in which diseased pulp tissue is removed from the pulp chamber and root canal and the area is sealed off.

8113.Definicao: A skin condition that enlarges blood vessels in the face, causing redness of the nose and other parts of the face.

8114.Definicao: A group of tendons and muscles used to raise the arm from the side and rotating the shoulder.

8115.Definicao: Indigestible dietary fiber found in grains, fruits, vegetables, and other foods. Roughage is thought to help prevent conditions such as constipation.

8116.Definicao: A tear or break in an organ or tissue. Tissue that protrudes through the rupture is known as a hernia.

8117.Definicao: When part of a spinal disk bulges out of a tear or weak spot in the disk’s tough outer shell. Also known as prolapsed disk or herniated disk.

8118.Definicao: The larger triangular bone at the base of the spine.

8119.Definicao: Abbreviation for seasonal affective disorder, sadness and depression brought on by a lack of exposure to sunlight. SAD usually appears in the fall or winter and subsides in the spring.

8120.Definicao: A watery solution that contains a small amount of salt and is often used to administer drugs or as a substitute for plasma.

8121.Definicao: One of three pairs of glands that pour lubricating fluids and digestive enzymes into the mouth.

8122.Definicao: A superficial blood vessel that extends from the thigh to the calf; it can be removed and used as a coronary bypass graft.

8123.Definicao: A membrane that covers the muscle fiber and ties the end of it to a tendon.

8124.Definicao: A person who can make a choice and be satisfied with it when presented with an option that meets his or her standards, without needing to examine all options or find the absolute best.

8125.Definicao: A type of fat found in animal foods such as meat, poultry skin, butter, and whole-milk dairy products, as well in as palm and coconut oils. A diet high in saturated fat tends to raise blood levels of unhealthy low-density lipoprotein (LDL) cholesterol.

8126.Definicao: A toe or finger swollen and red along its entire length.

8127.Definicao: A shoulder joint that connects the scapula to the ribs at the back of the chest.

8128.Definicao: A circular drainage system in the eye located where the clear cornea, white sclera, and colored iris meet to form an angle.

8129.Definicao: Pain along the course of the sciatic nerve (which runs from the buttock, down the back and side of the leg, and into the foot and toes), often because of a herniated disk.

8130.Definicao: The perception of flashing lights or lines that sometimes occurs during the aura of a migraine headache.

8131.Definicao: A surgical technique that indents the sclera and choroid to reattach the retina.

8132.Definicao: An autoimmune disease in which the skin thickens and hardens; sometimes other parts of the body are affected, and joint pain may result.

8133.Definicao: Sadness and depression brought on by a lack of exposure to sunlight. Seasonal affective disorder usually appears in the fall or winter and subsides in the spring. sometimes referred to as SAD.

8134.Definicao: High blood pressure that has an identifiable, often correctable, cause such as kidney disease, hyperthyroidism, sleep apnea and other conditions.

8135.Definicao: Bone loss associated with an identifiable medical condition, treatment with certain drugs, or immobility.

8136.Definicao: Shorthand for erythrocyte sedimentation rate—a test involving red blood cells used to check for different infections, inflammations, and cancers.

8137.Definicao: A sudden, involuntary contraction of muscles that results in rhythmic contortions of the body, often accompanied by a loss of consciousness. Also called a convulsion.

8138.Definicao: Chemically synthesized drugs that mimic estrogen in some tissues but act to block estrogen’s effects in others.

Traducoes.es: moduladores selectivos del receptor de estrógeno
Traducoes.pt: moduladores seletivos do receptor de estrogênio

8139.Definicao: Antidepressants that block the reuptake of serotonin into the neurons that released it, leaving more serotonin available to nerve cell receptors. Commonly used to treat depression and other mood disorders.

Traducoes.es: inhibidores selectivos de la recaptación de serotonina
Traducoes.pt: inibidores seletivos da recaptação de serotonina

8140.Definicao: A group of people who meet to discuss and offer assistance to one another with the goal of providing social support for changing troubling behavior patterns.

8141.Definicao: Structures surrounding the prostate gland involved in storing secretions made by the gland.

8142.Definicao: Gradual loss of body functions caused by the biological aging process, which increases risk of disease, disability, and death.

8143.Definicao: Diagnosis once given to people over 65 with dementia.

8144.Definicao: A set of structured exercises that sex therapists use to help couples focus on the sensual aspects of physical contact without pressure to achieve orgasm.

8145.Definicao: Permanent hearing loss caused by damage to the cochlea, hair cells, or auditory nerve.

8146.Definicao: A condition in which disease-causing organisms have spread to the bloodstream from an infection elsewhere in the body. Also known as blood poisoning.

8147.Definicao: A wall or other structure that divides one cavity from another. For example, in the heart the muscular septum separates the right side of the heart from the left side.

8148.Definicao: Abbreviation for selective estrogen receptor modulators, chemically synthesized drugs that mimic estrogen in some tissues but act to block estrogen’s effects in others.

8149.Definicao: A pocket of lymphatic fluid that builds up at an incision after surgery.

8150.Definicao: Antidepressants that slow the reuptake of both serotonin and norepinephrine into the neurons that released these substances, leaving more serotonin and norepinephrine available to nerve cell receptors. Commonly used to treat depression and other mood disorders.

Traducoes.es: inhibidores de la recaptación de serotonina-norepinefrina

8151.Definicao: A painful inflammation in and around two small bones known as sesamoids, located beneath the base of the big toe, at the ball of the foot.

8152.Definicao: A specific number of repetitions of an exercise done as a group.

8153.Definicao: A problem with any area of a person’s sexual response that causes distress.

8154.Definicao: Information the brain stores temporarily, from milliseconds to minutes.

8155.Definicao: Character strengths such as curiosity, integrity, and modesty that people identify with, appreciate having, and enjoy using.

8156.Definicao: The active ingredient in Viagra. It blocks the breakdown of cyclic guanosine monophosphate, a chemical necessary for an erection.

8157.Definicao: Heart attack that occurs without pain or symptoms; occurs most commonly in the elderly or in people with diabetes.

8158.Definicao: Shortage of oxygen delivery to the heart muscle that causes no symptoms.

8159.Definicao: A test using gamma rays to measure bone density, usually in the forearm.

8160.Definicao: The natural pacemaker of the heart. Located in the right atrium, the sinoatrial node, sometimes called the sinus node, initiates the heart's electrical activity.

8161.Definicao: A specialized group of heart cells in the right atrium that generate the electrical impulses that cause the heart muscle to contract. Also called the heart's natural pacemaker.

8162.Definicao: Muscles attached to bones throughout the body that allow voluntary movement to occur.

8163.Definicao: Any of several approaches to improve skin texture, tone, wrinkle appearance, and discolorations by promoting new collagen and epidermal growth. Chemical peels, dermabrasion, microdermabrasion, and laser procedures are skin-resurfacing techniques.

8164.Definicao: Temporary pause in breathing during sleep, lasting at least 10 seconds and associated with a fall in blood oxygen or arousal from sleep. Obstructive sleep apnea is caused by an obstruction in the airway blocking air flow; central sleep apnea occurs when the brain temporarily stops sending signals to the muscles that control breathing.

8165.Definicao: The pattern made when sleep stages are charted on a hypnogram.

8166.Definicao: On an electroencephalogram (EEG), brief rhythmic bursts of activity that appear during stage 2 sleep.

8167.Definicao: A slender piece of material surgically inserted under the urethra or bladder neck to provide support and improve continence.

8169.Definicao: Forward displacement of a vertebra in relation to the vertebra immediately below; also called spondylolisthesis.

8170.Definicao: One of two main types of skeletal muscle fibers. Slow-twitch fibers are recruited most heavily for endurance (aerobic) exercises. See also fast-twitch fiber.

8171.Definicao: Sleep stages 3 and 4; during slow-wave sleep the brain becomes less responsive to external stimuli.

8172.Definicao: An acronym for an approach to setting goals for behavioral changeset a very Specific goal; find a way to Measure progress; make sure it’s Achievable; make sure it’s Realistic; and set Time commitments.

8173.Definicao: The conventional eye chart used to test vision with lines of block letters in progressively smaller sizes.

8175.Definicao: A crystalline sugar alcohol used as a sweetening agent.

8176.Definicao: A hollow chamber into which inhaled medicines can be squirted before inhalation. Spacers are used with metered-dose inhalers to help deliver medicine effectively to the bronchial tubes and to reduce the amount of medicine left behind on the tongue and throat.

8178.Definicao: A congenital defect in which part of the spinal column fails to develop completely, leaving part of the spinal cord exposed.

8179.Definicao: A procedure to attach two or more vertebrae with a bone graft in order to eliminate motion and relieve pain.

8180.Definicao: A narrowing of the spinal canal, which can result in compression of nerve roots.

8181.Definicao: Use of a hollow needle to withdraw fluid from the lower part of the spinal canal for testing. Also called a lumbar puncture.

8182.Definicao: A painful spasm in the left upper abdomen below the rib cage, produced by areas of trapped gas in the colon.

8183.Definicao: Forward displacement of a vertebra in relation to the vertebra immediately below.

8184.Definicao: Porous bone, also called trabecular bone, often found at the center of long bones.

8186.Definicao: Abbreviation for selective serotonin reuptake inhibitors, antidepressants that block the reuptake of serotonin into the neurons that released it, leaving more serotonin available to nerve cell receptors. Commonly used to treat depression and other mood disorders.

8187.Definicao: Angina pectoris (chest pain with exertion or stress) that is well-controlled with medicines and lifestyle changes.

8188.Definicao: Narrowings in the heart arteries that cause angina pectoris in a predictable and stable pattern over time (for example, after walking a certain distance).

8189.Definicao: A model for how people make changes in their lives. According to this model, changes in behavior are made gradually and in relatively distinct stages.

8190.Definicao: The process of determining how far cancer has progressed. Staging is often used to determine the best course of treatment.

8191.Definicao: An herbal product in which what is believed to be the active ingredient meets an established standard of strength.

8192.Definicao: Cholesterol-lowering medications that interfere with the enzyme 3-hydroxy-3-methylglutaryl-coenzyme A reductase; also known as HMG-CoA reductase inhibitors. Statins work by changing the way the liver processes lipids.

8193.Definicao: Another term for corticosteroids—steroid medications made to mimic hormones produced naturally by the adrenal glands. They are used to treat a wide range of health problems.

8194.Definicao: A substance that speeds up chemical reactions inside cells and provides a boost of energy. Examples include caffeine and amphetamine.

8195.Definicao: The most superficial layer of the epidermis.

8196.Definicao: The ability of muscles to exert force.

8197.Definicao: Popular term for exercises that harness resistance supplied by body weight, free weights such as dumbbells or weighted cuffs, resistance bands, or specialized machines; also known as resistance training or weight training.

8198.Definicao: A hairline crack in a bone that usually occurs from overuse; left untreated, this may lead to displacement of the bones.

8199.Definicao: Physiological changes, such as quickened breathing and heartbeat and increased blood pressure, brought on by stress hormones released in response to a real or perceived threat to safety. Also called the fight-or-flight response.

8200.Definicao: A diagnostic test in which cardiovascular measurements such as heart rate, blood pressure, and electrical activity are recorded while the heart is being stressed (usually by having the person exercise on a treadmill or bicycle).

8201.Definicao: Stressful events or circumstances that may be real or perceived threats to equilibrium and well-being.

8202.Definicao: The abnormal narrowing of a hollow passage in the body, such as the esophagus or the urethra.

8203.Definicao: A disease or condition that progresses slower than an acute condition but faster than a chronic condition.

8204.Definicao: A painful version of thyroid inflammation caused by viral infection. Symptoms are flu-like and include fever, muscle aches and pains, and a painful, swollen thyroid gland. Also known as de Quervain’s thyroiditis.

8205.Definicao: A hemorrhagic stroke that occurs when a blood vessel on the surface of the brain bursts and bleeds into the space between the brain and the skull; usually caused by an aneurysm or other blood vessel malformation.

8206.Definicao: Space inside the brain where cerebrospinal fluid circulates.

8208.Definicao: Deepest layer of skin, which consists of connective tissue and fat.

8209.Definicao: A blood clot in the brain between the cerebral cortex and the dura.

8210.Definicao: Heart-muscle cells on the inside of the heart chambers; these cells are highly susceptible to damage from blockages of the major coronary arteries.

8211.Definicao: A condition characterized by excessive and often compulsive substance use, impaired control over substance use, continued use of substances despite adverse consequences, and withdrawal symptoms that emerge when the substance use is discontinued.

8212.Definicao: Vaccines using only part of a microbe—the antigens—to elicit an immune response; these vaccines tend to cause fewer adverse reactions than vaccines which contain the whole microbe.

8213.Definicao: The V-shaped hollow at the margin of the tooth and gum.

8214.Definicao: Confusion or disorientation beginning at the end of the day and continuing into the night; often occurs in people with Alzheimer's disease or vascular dementia.

8215.Definicao: Two or more exercises combined for a more vigorous workout. During a superset, all the reps of exercise A are performed and then all the reps of exercise B before resting.

8216.Definicao: A small group of nerve cells located in the hypothalamus that controls the sleep/wake cycle.

8217.Definicao: An offshoot of the autonomic nervous system; it sends signals to prepare the body for action when stress hormones are released in response to perceived or real dangers.

8218.Definicao: Exercise test, usually using a treadmill or bicycle, that increases in difficulty at set stages and is stopped when the person develops chest pain, breathlessness, or extreme fatigue.

Traducoes.es: prueba de esfuerzo con ejercicio limitado por síntomas
Traducoes.pt: teste de esforço com sintomas limitados

8219.Definicao: A thick liquid that lubricates the joints and tendons.

8220.Definicao: The most mobile type of joint; found in the shoulders, wrists, fingers, hips, etc.

8221.Definicao: A thin membrane that lines joint capsules and produces synovial fluid.

8222.Definicao: A connective tissue disease that can affect internal organs, nervous system, skin, and joints.

8223.Definicao: The first or top number in a blood pressure reading; a measure of the pressure blood exerts against arterial walls when the heart contracts.

8224.Definicao: The inability of the heart to pump blood efficiently due to weakening and enlargement of the ventricles. Systolic heart failure is usually caused by coronary artery disease, high blood pressure, and valvular heart disease.

8225.Definicao: Abbreviation for T lymphocyte, a type of white blood cell that is produced in the bone marrow and is part of the body’s immune system.

8226.Definicao: A type of white blood cell that is produced in the bone marrow and is part of the body’s immune system. Also called a T cell.

8227.Definicao: An abnormally fast heartbeat, usually above 100 beats per minute.

8228.Definicao: A drug used by women to prevent breast cancer or its recurrence.

8229.Definicao: Also called neurofibrillary tangles—twisted strands of proteins that are found inside the dead or dying nerve cells of people with Alzheimer's disease.

8230.Definicao: Involuntary writhing movements of the arms, legs, and tongue caused by high doses of antipsychotic drugs over long periods of time.

8231.Definicao: An inherited condition in which two bones of the foot are fused together; can result in rigid flat feet.

8232.Definicao: A hardened layer of plaque that builds up on teeth. Also called calculus.

8233.Definicao: Abbreviation for telecommunications device for the deaf—machinery that allows a person who is deaf or hard of hearing to send and receive typed messages over the telephone.

8234.Definicao: Machinery that allows a person who is deaf or hard of hearing to send and receive typed messages over the telephone.

8235.Definicao: When applied to exercise, the count for key movements in an exercise.

8236.Definicao: Also called cranial arteritis and giant cell arteritis—inflammation and damage to blood vessels supplying blood to the head and neck.

8237.Definicao: Inflammation of a tendon, usually caused by injury; may cause pain and restrict movement of the muscle attached to the tendon.

8238.Definicao: Alternative spelling of tendinitis—inflammation of a tendon, usually caused by injury; may cause pain and restrict movement of the muscle attached to the tendon.

8239.Definicao: Swelling and inflammation of the protective sheath covering the tendons, which decreases the sheath’s production of synovial fluid.

8240.Definicao: Abbreviation for transcutaneous electrical nerve stimulation—the use of low-voltage electrical current (through electrodes placed on the skin) to provide pain-suppressing stimulation.

8241.Definicao: A drug used to treat symptoms of an enlarged prostate gland. It relieves constriction of the urethra and improves urine flow by relaxing the smooth muscle tissue in the capsule that surrounds the prostate.

8242.Definicao: A pattern of brain waves on an electroencephalogram (EEG) characteristic of light, stage 1 sleep.

8244.Definicao: Agents or medications that dissolve blood clots and restore blood flow through a blocked artery; used to treat myocardial infarction, ischemic stroke, and pulmonary embolism. Also called clot busters. Examples include tissue plasminogen activator (tPA) and streptokinase.

8245.Definicao: A sudden, excruciating headache that may be the result of bleeding in the head.

8246.Definicao: A two-lobed gland located in the front of the neck below the larynx (voice box). It secretes hormones that help regulate the body's metabolism and calcium balance.

8247.Definicao: Two iodine-containing hormones called thyroxine (T4) and triiodothyronine (T3). They help regulate the body's metabolism and calcium balance.

8248.Definicao: A hormone secreted into the bloodstream by the pituitary gland that stimulates the thyroid gland. Doctors measure levels of TSH to determine whether a person’s thyroid hormone levels are normal.

8249.Definicao: One of two types of major thyroid hormone manufactured by the thyroid gland. It contains four iodine atoms. Also known as T4.

8250.Definicao: Abbreviation for transient ischemic attack, a brain attack that resolves on its own within 24 hours. Sometimes called a mini-stroke, a TIA is often an early warning sign of an impending stroke.

8251.Definicao: Pain from a disorder of the trigeminal nerve, the chief sensory nerve of the face. Also called trigeminal neuralgia.

8252.Definicao: An antiplatelet drug that prevents the formation of blood clots.

8253.Definicao: An herbal product made by soaking an herb or other plant material in a mixture of water and alcohol to extract certain ingredients believed to be medicinal or beneficial.

8254.Definicao: An itchy condition of the scalp caused by a fungal infection. Also known as ringworm.

8256.Definicao: A clot-dissolving enzyme produced naturally in the blood vessels and artificially produced as a medication. Tissue plasminogen activator (commonly known as tPA) is used to break down blood clots in the treatment of heart attack, ischemic stroke, and pulmonary embolism. tPA must be used within a few hours after symptoms begin.

8257.Definicao: The highest amount of a nutrient deemed likely to have no harmful health effects for almost all healthy people when taken consistently.

8258.Definicao: A glaucoma screening test that measures pressure inside the eye.

8259.Definicao: Infectious disease that attacks the teeth. Also called dental caries.

8260.Definicao: Pertaining to an external surface of the body, such as the skin, mouth, vagina, or anus; often used to describe the administration of medicine that is applied directly to such a surface.

8261.Definicao: Pertaining to something that is poisonous.

8262.Definicao: An enlarged thyroid gland with nodules that produce excess thyroid hormone. This type of goiter is to blame for hyperthyroidism in many people over 60.

8263.Definicao: Vaccines that protect against harmful bacterial toxins. These vaccines contain toxins that have been detoxified and rendered inactive.

8264.Definicao: Abbreviation for tissue plasminogen activator, a clot-dissolving enzyme produced naturally in the blood vessels and artificially produced as a medication. tPA is used to break down blood clots in the treatment of heart attack, ischemic stroke, and pulmonary embolism. tPA must be used within a few hours after symptoms begin.

8265.Definicao: Bone tissue arranged in a meshwork of thin plates or beams that is commonly found at the center of long bones and that composes a large part of the hip and vertebrae. Also called cancellous bone or spongy bone.

8266.Definicao: A system of fine, mesh-like tissue in the anterior chamber of the eye through which aqueous humor drains; located in the angle where the clear cornea, white sclera, and colored iris join.

8267.Definicao: A standard surgical procedure for glaucoma that creates a new channel for fluid drainage from the anterior chamber to the sub-conjunctival space.

8268.Definicao: A laser procedure that burns small holes on the eye's trabecular meshwork to ease the flow of aqueous humor from the eye.

8269.Definicao: A mineral that is required only in tiny amounts in the diet to maintain health; the principal trace minerals are chromium, copper, selenium, sulfur, and zinc.

8270.Definicao: A type of fat made during hydrogenation of liquid vegetable oil. Trans fats are found in many solid margarines, commercially prepared baked goods, and fried foods in many restaurants. Trans fats increase harmful low-density lipoprotein, decrease protective high-density lipoprotein, and promote blood clotting and inflammation. Also known as trans fat.

8271.Definicao: An ultrasound technique that makes images of the major arteries at the base of the brain.

8272.Definicao: The use of low-voltage electrical current (through electrodes placed on the skin) to provide pain-suppressing stimulation.

8274.Definicao: A measure of iron circulating in the blood.

8275.Definicao: A brain attack that resolves on its own within 24 hours. Sometimes called a mini-stroke or TIA, a transient ischemic attack is often an early warning sign of an impending stroke.

8277.Definicao: Heart attack that destroys the entire thickness of a section of heart muscle.

8278.Definicao: A procedure that uses sound waves to create an image of the prostate gland as a means of detecting cancer. Sound waves are directed to the prostate from a probe inserted in the rectum.

8279.Definicao: An operation used to treat benign prostatic hyperplasia (enlarged prostate gland) in which incisions are made in prostate tissue to relieve pressure on the urethra and ease urinary difficulties.

8280.Definicao: A heat therapy for benign prostatic hyperplasia (enlarged prostate gland) that uses microwaves to destroy prostate tissue that obstructs urine flow.

8281.Definicao: A procedure that uses radio waves to heat and destroy cells in the prostate gland that are obstructing the urethra.

8282.Definicao: An operation used to treat benign prostatic hyperplasia (enlarged prostate gland) in which excess prostate tissue is surgically removed.

8283.Definicao: The ringlike projection on each side of a vertebra to which muscles and ligaments are attached and, in the chest area, to which the ribs are connected.

8284.Definicao: A prolonged, intense reaction to bereavement that affects one in 10 people who lose a loved one. Key signs are inability to accept the death; frequent nightmares and intrusive, upsetting memories; detachment from others; constant yearning for the deceased; and excessive loneliness. Also known as complicated grief or chronic grief.

8285.Definicao: A three-flap valve that sits between the right atrium and the right ventricle.

8286.Definicao: Anything that can set off symptoms.

8287.Definicao: A tender area that, when stimulated, also elicits pain elsewhere in the body.

8288.Definicao: One of two types of major thyroid hormone manufactured by the thyroid gland. It contains three iodine atoms. Also known as T3.

8289.Definicao: A groove in front of the femur where the patella moves as the knee bends and straightens.

8290.Definicao: Proteins found in heart muscle that leak into the circulation during a heart attack or other heart injury.

8291.Definicao: A legal entity in which assets are gathered during a person’s lifetime. That person may control distributions directly or through trustees elected to carry out wishes at a time or point specified. After death, remaining assets are distributed to beneficiaries.

8292.Definicao: An enzyme secreted by the pancreas that helps digest proteins.

8293.Definicao: Any type of swelling or enlargement of tissues; most often used to describe an abnormal growth of tissue, which can be cancerous or noncancerous.

8294.Definicao: The dense fibrous membrane surrounding each corpus cavernosum and the corpus spongiosum in the penis.

8296.Definicao: A type of diabetes, a chronic condition that affects the way the body's tissues use sugar (glucose), their main source of fuel. Once called juvenile-onset diabetes and insulin-dependent diabetes. People with this form of diabetes don't make enough insulin, a hormone that controls the movement of glucose into cells. They must rely on insulin injections.

8297.Definicao: Bone loss due to estrogen decline associated with menopause.

8298.Definicao: A type of diabetes, a chronic condition that affects the way the body's tissues use sugar (glucose), their main source of fuel. Once called adult -onset diabetes and non-insulin-dependent diabetes. People with this form of the disease have tissues that either resist the effects of insulin (a hormone that control the movement of sugar into cells) or the body doesn't produce enough insulin. It is initially treated with diet, exercise, weight-loss if needed, and oral medications.

8300.Definicao: A break in the skin or other surface that often occurs along with inflammation, infection, or cancerous growth.

8301.Definicao: Estrogen taken without an accompanying progestogen.

8302.Definicao: Personal losses that are not acknowledged and mourned. Many mental health experts believe that reactions to these losses crop up later, often skewing a person’s response to an entirely different loss.

8303.Definicao: Healthy dietary fats from plant sources such as vegetable oils, nuts, and whole grains, as well as from fatty fish. Includes monounsaturated fat and polyunsaturated fat.

8304.Definicao: Chest pain that occurs or worsens in frequency, severity, or duration when a person is at rest or engaging in mild activity.

8305.Definicao: Inhalation that requires undue extra exertion; this extra work may cause insomnia and daytime sleepiness.

Traducoes.es: síndrome de resistencia de las vías respiratorias superiores
Traducoes.pt: síndrome de resistência das vias aéreas superiores

8306.Definicao: Muscular valve located at the upper portion of the esophagus that opens to allow food or liquid to enter the digestive system.

8307.Definicao: Movement of the urethra out of place when abdominal pressure increases, leading to stress incontinence.

8308.Definicao: The sudden and uncontrollable need to urinate or defecate.

8309.Definicao: Routinely needing to urinate more than eight times during the day or more than twice at night.

8310.Definicao: Part of the body that produces and excretes urine. It consists of the kidneys, ureters, bladder, and urethra.

8311.Definicao: A small, fleshy flap of tissue that hangs from the back of the throat over the root of the tongue.

8312.Definicao: A surgical treatment for obstructive sleep apnea that involves removing the uvula, the tonsils, and a rim of loose tissue at the back of the soft palate.

8313.Definicao: Various manual or battery-operated pumps that a man can use to draw blood into the penis to create an erection.

8314.Definicao: Structures consisting of leaflets that divide the chambers of the heart and prevent the backflow of blood from one chamber to another during contraction of the heart.

8315.Definicao: Also called Prinzmetal's angina, these are attacks of chest pain caused by spasms of one or more coronary arteries almost always while a person is at rest.

8316.Definicao: Having to do with blood vessels and circulation.

8317.Definicao: Dementia caused by narrowing or blockage of blood vessels in the brain or by a stroke or series of tiny strokes. Also called multi-infarct dementia.

8319.Definicao: An operation that ties off or cuts the tubes through which sperm travel from the testicles to the urethra; used as a form of birth control.

8320.Definicao: A substance or condition, such as drugs, cold, fear, and nicotine, that causes blood vessels to narrow and thus de­creases the flow of blood.

8321.Definicao: A widening of the blood vessels that results in increased blood flow.

8322.Definicao: A vessel that carries blood back to the heart.

8324.Definicao: Seepage of blood out of a vein.

8325.Definicao: Machine that inflates the lungs with oxygen.

8326.Definicao: One of the two lower chambers of the heart. The right ventricle pumps blood to the lungs; the left ventricle pumps blood to the rest of the body.

8327.Definicao: Abnormal heart rhythm that starts in the lower chambers of the heart; this rhythm disturbance can occur as a complication of a heart attack and impairs the heart's pumping ability.

8328.Definicao: A deadly heart rhythm in which the ventricles contract independently of the atria and in a chaotic manner.

8329.Definicao: Heart muscle that makes up the lower chambers of the heart.

8330.Definicao: Break in the heart muscle that allows blood to escape into the pericardial sac.

8331.Definicao: One or more holes in the septum, the muscular wall separating the right and left sides of the heart.

8333.Definicao: One of the cylindrical bones that form the spine (pluralvertebrae).

8334.Definicao: A minimally invasive procedure to stabilize compressed vertebrae and alleviate pain. A needle is inserted into the compressed portion of a vertebra and surgical cement is injected to support the vertebra and prevent further collapse.

8335.Definicao: Dizziness; often a spinning sensation or a feeling that the ground is tilting.

8336.Definicao: A weight-loss diet that allows 800 or fewer calories per day (usually followed under medical supervision).

8337.Definicao: A lipoprotein that transports triglyceride manufactured in the liver to fat tissue in the body. VLDL eventually becomes low-density lipoprotein (LDL) after the triglyceride has been removed.

8338.Definicao: The balance organs, located in the labyrinth in the inner ear.

8339.Definicao: Pertaining to or caused by a virus.

8340.Definicao: Core characteristics that are universally valued by philosophers and religions across time and cultures, such as wisdom and courage.

8341.Definicao: A disease or condition that is highly infectious or dangerous or rapidly progressing.

8342.Definicao: The internal organs, especially those found in the abdomen.

8343.Definicao: Fat that lies beneath the abdominal wall, in the spaces surrounding the liver, intestines, and other organs. Sometimes called belly fat or abdominal adiposity.

8344.Definicao: The part of the occipital lobe in the brain that processes visual stimuli.

8345.Definicao: A technique used to treat benign prostatic hyperplasia (enlarged prostate gland) that allows the surgeon to view the prostate directly while it is being shrunk by a laser beam.

8346.Definicao: A hormone that plays a key role in ensuring the absorption of calcium from the intestines.

8347.Definicao: The clear, gel-like substance that fills the space behind the lens of the eye and supports the shape of the rear portion of the eye.

8348.Definicao: Abbreviation for very-low-density lipoprotein, a lipoprotein that transports triglyceride manufactured in the liver to fat tissue in the body. VLDL eventually becomes low-density lipoprotein (LDL) after the triglyceride has been removed.

8349.Definicao: The body’s maximum capacity for oxygen consumption during peak exertion. Also known as aerobic power, maximal oxygen consumption, or cardiorespiratory endurance capacity.

8350.Definicao: Unstable components of a preparation that evaporate easily.

8351.Definicao: Abbreviation for ventricular septal defect—one or more holes in the septum, the muscular wall separating the right and left sides of the heart.

8352.Definicao: An agent that is believed to aid in wound healing.

8353.Definicao: Inflammation of the tissue around the opening of the vagina that makes sexual activity painful.

8354.Definicao: Pain in the vulva that may or may not be brought on by touch or pressure.

8355.Definicao: Force on the wall of the heart muscle caused by pressure inside the heart's pumping chamber; excessive wall stress can impair the heart's ability to pump and increase the heart's need for oxygen.

8356.Definicao: An anticoagulant drug that prevents blood clotting; people taking it must have regular blood tests to determine that their blood does not clot too readily or too slowly.

8357.Definicao: An abnormal fibrous growth caused by a viral infection.

8358.Definicao: Salty-tasting salivary secretions stimulated by gastroesophageal reflux.

8359.Definicao: A hearing test that uses a tuning fork to diagnose one-sided hearing loss.

8360.Definicao: An irreversible state of acute confusion and amnesia that develops in alcoholics as a result of malnutrition-related thiamine deficiency.

8361.Definicao: The brain region responsible for the comprehension of speech.

8362.Definicao: The popular term for muscle and ligament damage resulting from rapid and extreme extension and flexion of the neck. The term is also used for the accident causing the injury, most often a rear-end motor vehicle accident.

8363.Definicao: The inner portion of the brain, composed primarily of axons, each surrounded by a myelin sheath that insulates the nerve fibers (and appears white). Messages are sent between different regions of the brain (gray matter) via these nerve fibers.

8364.Definicao: Blood pressure that is elevated in a doctor’s office but is normal at home.

8365.Definicao: A legal document that describes what should be done with a person's assets after his or her death.

8366.Definicao: A type of short-term memory process that involves temporarily storing and manipulating information.

8368.Definicao: A laser technique to correct blurred vision caused by cloudiness that may develop in the skin of the cataract left in the eye after cataract surgery; a laser is used to create a hole in the membrane to allow light to enter clearly focused onto the retina.

8369.Definicao: An extract of the bark of a West African tree sometimes used in treating erectile dysfunction. Yohimbine appears to increase blood flow to the penis and prevent blood from leaving it too quickly.

8370.Definicao: Thin, gelatinous ligaments that attach the lens to the ciliary body and support the lens centrally behind the pupil.

8371.Definicao: An infectious disease that is transmissible under normal conditions from animals to humans.

8372.Definicao: The abdomen is actually just another word for your stomach.

8373.Definicao: Part of the immune system, lymph nodes at the back of your nose, above your tonsils. If they’re too large and causing breathing problems, you may need to have them removed.

8374.Definicao: These are part of the endocrine system and secrete hormones (chemical messengers that turn on and off processes in the body). Your adrenal glands are on top of each kidney.

8375.Definicao: This is when you lose some or all of your hair. This can be caused by medicines or it can be due to an autoimmune disease, where the body becomes mis-programmed and attacks itself rather than a foreign invader, such as a germ.

8376.Definicao: A condition where your red blood cells cannot carry enough oxygen. It makes you feel tired and you may look pale. There are lots of different types of anaemia – some are more serious than others.

8377.Definicao: If you're under an anaesthetic, you won't feel any pain during a test or an operation. It's a special mixture of drugs, which can be breathed or injected. A general anaesthetic will let you 'sleep' while everything's going on, so you won't feel anything or know what is happening.

8378.Definicao: An anaesthetist is a specially-trained doctor who will look will make sure you 'sleep' safely during an operation or test, and make sure that you get better afterwards. They also help manage your pain after surgery.

8380.Definicao: Lots of people have allergies, which means they can't eat certain foods or touch some materials. Anaphylaxis is a severe type of allergic reaction.

8381.Definicao: This is a special X-ray picture of an artery - that's the vessel that takes blood from your heart to the rest of your body.

8382.Definicao: The period of time before a baby is born. For instance, antenatal screening is used to find out if the baby is alright before it is born.
